column4: My Ubuntu Has Netcat preinstall in it but how do i access it, PLZ tell me
it's a command-line app; try 'nc -h' for help
please don't repeat yourself. it looks like it's in 'main'
sorry, scrap that
looks like i have an old version from marillat. maybe it's on hoary-extras?
it isnt on the extras
sorry, i barely remember installing it
do you get an error message? if so, what is it?
& nalioth , the error says cannot remove vmware-distrib/: Is a Directory
i used rm -d but it was useless
you still haven't told us what you're trying to achieve ;)
take a look here: http://www.troubleshooters.com/linux/coasterless.htm  -- has some good tips on ripping/burning cds
yes
you mean upgrade a hoary to breezy?
do have an idea on how i can mount and .iso file as a cd-rom drive and use that drive to update hoary to breezy
oh, sorry
to mount use 'mount -o loop filename.iso /mnt/cdrom' (/mnt/cdrom can be somewhere else)
maybe it hasn't been created yet
yes it does but only .tar.gz from and i dunno how to install them
double click on the tar file in nautilus to look inside
look for a file like 'README' or 'INSTALL' for instructions
ok i will try searching for download managers
tar xjf file.tar.bz2   (or xjvf)
